claim: Computed network-based accessibility isochrones (500m bus, 1000m rail) following SDG 11.2.1 methodology
notes: Used OSMnx for network download and Pandana for isochrone computation. Network distance provides more accurate access measurement than Euclidean buffers.

claim: Achieved ~30x speedup using Pandana vs NetworkX for shortest path queries
notes: Pandana uses C++ backend with Contraction Hierarchies. Benchmark performed on downtown Atlanta walk network with 100 destination queries.

claim: Created interactive Kepler.gl dashboard with Census Tracts, Isochrones, and MARTA stops
notes: Dashboard embedded locally in portfolio site. Layers include ARC 2020 Census Tracts, 500m walk isochrone, and filtered MARTA stops.

claim: Analyzed urban displacement patterns using UDP typology data
notes: Used validated UDP gentrification typologies for Atlanta census tracts. Identified 'green gentrification' correlation with BeltLine proximity.

claim: Developed displacement risk prediction model with Spatial Cross-Validation
notes: Demonstration model using Spatial K-Fold CV to prevent optimistic bias from spatial autocorrelation. Not validated for operational use.

claim: Collaborated with team members (Khadijah, Maymuna) on research scope and methodology
notes: Regular team meetings throughout Fall 2023 - Fall 2024. Joint work on literature review, methodology design, and results interpretation.

claim: Identified 'green gentrification' paradox along Atlanta BeltLine corridor
notes: BeltLine investment improves SDG 11.7.1 (public space) but correlates with 'Becoming Exclusive' tract typologies - a policy paradox requiring anti-displacement measures.
